sentences.en: "Send her away," Eve said in a cold, hard voice.
sentences.cn: “把她打发走。”伊芙冷酷无情地说道。

sentences.en: Adam and Eve dwelt in paradise.
sentences.cn: 亚当和夏娃生活在伊甸园里.

sentences.en: Eve isn't the type to sit around doing nothing.
sentences.cn: 伊芙不是那种喜欢坐在那里无所事事的人。
伊芙几乎赞同地点了点头。“确实如此。”
伊夫一口回绝了马克的邀请。

sentences.en: Eve walked briskly down the corridor to her son's room.
sentences.cn: 伊芙步履轻快地穿过走廊来到儿子的房间。

sentences.en: Eve, squinting at the clock, saw it was just on 7 a.m.
sentences.cn: 伊夫眯着眼瞥了一下钟，看到差不多是早上7点钟。

sentences.en: He felt sick on the eve of the race.
In China the custom prevails in eating dumplings on New Year's Eve.
sentences.cn: 在中国,除夕晚上吃饺子的风俗很盛行.

sentences.en: Richard had turned up on Christmas Eve with Tony.
sentences.cn: 理查德和托尼在圣诞夜一道露面了。

sentences.en: St. Patrick's Cathedral is famed for its midnight mass on Christmas eve.
sentences.cn: 圣巴特里克大教堂以其圣诞前夜的午夜弥撒著称.

sentences.en: The evening party will take place on New Year's Eve.
sentences.cn: 晚会将在除夕那天举行.

sentences.en: Tramcars ran throughout the night on New Year's Eve.
sentences.cn: 有轨电车除夕通宵行驶.

sentences.en: We'll have a party on New Year's Eve.
sentences.cn: 我们将在除夕举行晚会.

words.tran_cn: 在晚上的；为晚上的；晚上用的
多事的；重要的；多变故的；重大的
晚上；傍晚；（联欢性的）晚会；后期

trans.tran_en: the night or day before an important day
